meanings.sent1: The papyrine texture of the leaves made them feel delicate.
meanings.sent2: The ancient scroll had a papyrine appearance, showing its age.
meanings.sent3: The papyrine hat he wore crumpled easily, making him look like a walking paper ball.
meanings.sent4: Her skin, soft and papyrine, seemed to absorb the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The papyrine quality of the book made it easy to tear, just like paper.

meanings.definition: Made of or relating to papyrus.
meanings.sent1: The papyrine scroll contained ancient writings that fascinated historians.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed a papyrine artifact from the Egyptian era.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her papyrine shoes were so old, they might have been worn by Cleopatra.
meanings.sent4: His papyrine necklace symbolized his connection to the past.
meanings.sent5: The papyrine boat floated gracefully on the river, reminiscent of ancient times.

meanings.sent1: The papyrine envelope crinkled as she opened it with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The papyrine texture of the wallpaper gave the room a cozy feel.
meanings.sent3: His papyrine voice was so soft, it sounded like a whispering sheet of paper.
meanings.sent4: The papyrine wings of the butterfly fluttered gently in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The papyrine nature of the map made it easy to fold and carry on their journey.
